body:
Hi

I ran

```
user@node176[~]$ spack load -r readline@7.0%gcc@6.3.0 arch=linux-centos7-x86_64
==> Error: the constraint '['readline@7.0%gcc@6.3.0', 'arch=linux-centos7-x86_64']' matches multiple packages:
        readline@7.0%gcc@6.3.0 arch=linux-centos7-x86_64 
        readline@7.0%gcc@6.3.0 arch=linux-centos7-x86_64 
        readline@7.0%gcc@6.3.0 arch=linux-centos7-x86_64 

==> Error: In this context exactly **one** match is needed: please specify your constraints better.
```

Which is a much-needed feature.  **Thank you!**

Though how to I discern among these versions?

As you can see the only differences are hash so how do I make `spack load` choose the right one?  It would be ideal if that could be done without hash since most users are familar with loading via hash.

```

user@node176[~]$ spack find -l -L -v readline@7.0%gcc@6.3.0
==> 3 installed packages.
-- linux-centos7-x86_64 / gcc@6.3.0 -----------------------------
4pfytjk3oyixbbluigyxp2ij3kbdllje readline@7.0  rnltvzmb7ap7mf6bgarjhdcfu4kmxyph readline@7.0  h2aywb5uil33uyhq44ytmrs3wrxf5kxg readline@7.0
```
title: spack load: the constraint 'spec' matches multiple packages
